newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka's Kadirgamar leaves for Indian Ocean meet.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka's Kadirgamar leaves for Indian Ocean meet.

text.p: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Lakshman Kadirgamar left for Mauritius on Tuesday to attend the first ministerial meeting of the Indian Ocean rim states, a foreign ministry spokesman said.

The 14-nation forum, to be called the Indian Ocean Rim Association for Regional Cooperation (IORARC), includes Australia, Indonesia, India, Kenya, Madagascar, Malaysia, Mauritius, Mozambique, Oman, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Singapore, Tanzania and Yemen.
The three-day meeting of foreign ministers from member nations will adopt a draft charter of the forum at Port Louis. It starts on Wednesday.

"It is an important meeting since we are adopting a charter. At the moment the thrust is trade and investment, not security. We will have to wait and see whether it extends to security," Kadirgamar told Reuters in an interview last month.
He said this week's meeting was likely to also discuss the important membership issue.
"There are those who feel the membership should be kept small and there are those who say it should be expanded to embrace the entire Indian Ocean region," Kadirgamar said.
"A consensus is likely to emerge that we should stay with the 14 members until the fledgling organisation begins to move a little," he said.

An Indian foreign ministry document earlier said the member countries accounted for nearly 64 percent of global trade flows of $1.0 trillion and also had a substantial degree of intra-trade and investment.
